bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, December 30, 1940

div1.p: Hench promises to send Truby memorabilia on the Washington and Jefferson College events and to start working on Truby's manuscript.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, December 30, 1940
div1.opener:
Y F.
December 30, 1940
General Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
My dear General Truby:
div1.p:
Quite properly, General Kean was distressed to hear
from you that you had not heard from me since the Washington
and Jefferson affair, and he sent me a one-line note to that
effect. I assured him that I had been corresponding with
you but I did not know that you did not receive the illustrated
program and clippings which I sent to you just after the Wash-
ington and Jefferson affair. We have checked on this, and they
were sent, but I am sending you another set as I think you will
be interested in them.

I have cleared my desk of everything else and tomorrow
I am starting to make my detailed comments to you which will be
sent within a few days.

Washington and Jefferson has just printed a memorial
booklet on the Lazear Memorial. I have only received one but
have sent for others and will send you one, as I am sure you
will like it.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
